name: External Reference
description: The XBR data type is used to represent references to external systems, documents, or data sources that are related to but not contained within the current HL7 message. It provides structured information for linking to external resources such as images, documents, web services, or other healthcare information systems. XBR enables healthcare applications to maintain connections to distributed information while preserving message integrity and supporting complex healthcare information architectures.

XBR.1.name: External Reference Type
XBR.1.description: Specifies the type of external reference (e.g., URL, FILE, DATABASE, SYSTEM). Indicates the nature and access method for the external resource.

XBR.2.name: External Reference Identifier
XBR.2.description: The unique identifier or locator for the external resource (e.g., URL, file path, database key). Provides the specific reference needed to access the external information.

XBR.3.name: External Reference Version ID
XBR.3.description: Version identifier for the external resource to ensure reference accuracy over time. Supports versioning of external documents and data sources.

XBR.4.name: External Reference Description
XBR.4.description: Human-readable description of the external resource content or purpose. Provides context for understanding the nature and relevance of the external reference.

constraints.referenceType: External reference type should reference valid values from table 0498
constraints.identifierValidation: External reference identifier should be valid for the specified reference type
constraints.accessibility: External references should be accessible to authorized systems and users
constraints.versionControl: Version IDs should accurately reflect the referenced resource version
